name: Saint Seiya: Soldiers' Soul
description: The 12 Gold Saints are coming back to burn their cosmos with outstanding graphics, solid gameplay, characters from the whole series… and so much more to discover!

reviews.review_text: I don't usually 'review' games, but this game is how all the games should be! No just for Saint Seiya fans but for all gamers, to have the ability to unlock more content by yourself instead of 'buyin' dlcs makes the game unique! Graphics are awesome and the game also bring back memories from childhood! This game is highly recommended!

Very good product with fast gameplay , easy control with my Xbox 360 Windows controller,  Pro 1) Good voice acting 2) Crystal clear sound 3) If you like street fighter game 4 then you would like this game too, same level of graphic 4) Good in depth tutorial for beginner and those never play before. 5) No bugs , no glitch , no need to patch , ++++++++++  Con I read some negative feedback from steam that they wont even start the game , but most of them dont know how to install the game , they dont know Windows , directX , So their feedback can be ignored . I have no problem at all.
Quite simple but fun and addicting, but definitely only for fans of the anime.

I thought that the game maybe would be some kind a bad fight gaming, but after playing for 1 hour straight, I nostalgically, watched every video with Portuguese dub, what was amazing and make me ignore the cut scenes, that is only what is passing in the room, like when Shiryu defeated Deathmask and talk with Doko, Doko does not appear and his voice also does not, but the plot is there, for someone who's not fan this maybe this is some flaw on the history... and the frozen characters on talk is just that hilarious, that make me feel like watch all the scenes again with a better 3D view.  The fight is just curious, It has some beautiful in it, I like how hard it is to fight against the Gold Saints and the talk in the fights, even it is repeated is cool to see how the history merge into it.  Well, the game is more than I was expecting, so yes, worth the previous price to pay for it.

Designed as easy-to-play, SSSS focuses really on recreating the scenes and characters in the original anime. They did a decent job. They also used as many original VOs as possible. The only thing I don't like is the grinding part of the game. I finished the game in about 5 hours with around 80% completion. The amount of coins I earned could probably be used to purchase 1% of what the collection store has to offer. That is some ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t.
Awesome game and in special if you are Saint Seiya fan like me! Totally nostalgic and I recommend this game!

PRO : + Big character roster, some with multiple selectible Big Bang Attack (ultimate attack). You can't get bored of the characters. + Unique characters with unique combo and special attacks. + Interesting story, four chapters in total. + Variety of game modes like Survival, Tournament, Online, Battle of gold + Great battle animation, more on close quarters combat. + Achievements on each story battle.   CON : - The story is too short - It's quite hard to earn money to buy stuff

IF YOU ARE A NOSTALGIC FAN OF SAINT SEIYA READ THIS !  PROS: -The combat system is fast and exciting it remainds the DBZ Budokai tenkaichi saga -Lots of characthers and costumes (new armors, training suites, etc) -It has the four main Sagas to play in story mode (Sanctuary/Asgard/Poseidon/Hades with Elyseos field) CONS: -The cinematics in the story mode are awful, they are almost just standing models with lip sync -Only one special ability has a cinematic in the fights, some charechters can have more than one cinematic ability but you have to choose only one to use in the match -Has a grafic Bug wich lags the game and desyncronize the voices (but is easy fixed with resolution changing, and a bit of code script) -The voices other than Japanese have no soul  Overall is a great game, if you like fighting games and Saint Seiya you will enjoy it a lot
This game brings back my childhood. A must buy game for me.

I wish I could say this game is great. I bought it because of nostalgia and that's really the only reason anyone should even consider buying it. It has very cheap animation, there are things you expect out of a saint seiya game, one being armour damage and blood. The show had lots of this and it really doesn't seem like a stretch to expect these things. But here's my real problem wiht the game, they cheaped out on basic things like the destruction of the pillars in the poseidon saga. It was obviously a cheaply made game to bank on nostalgia idiots like me. Don't buy it, save your money and maybe buy the dvd set. Much more fun than this. I will wait for a good saint seiya game, maybe one day I'll get one.

I love this game. The game play is super simple yet easy to figure out. Its not like xenoverse where its a controller breaker game, those damn Saiyans. What I like how they got this game very accurate where the cutscenes are just as slow as the manga. My only issue is where is Jabu?

From the first battle I've played in this game, I couldn't stopped thinking that I've already played game with familliar gameplay. And yes, I was right - 'Naruto Shippuden Ultimate Ninja Storm 3' and '...4' have very simular gameplay. Unfortunately, when compared, this game loses almost in everything.  The first and main problem for me is story. God damn, it's BORING. I didn't watch anime (if there is) and never played any games from this universe (if there are any) and, if you think, that I shouldn't even started playing this game without doing these things, then you will be wrong. In Naruto games (which I mensioned earlier) I also haven't any information about story, characters, etc., but I still had A LOT of fun playing story mode in both of those games. I understood everything, I was involved in plot. I didn't think 'WTF is going on?' or 'Why are you saying/doing this?'. This game does not do this. In every cutscene I have to break my face with facepalms, caused by unbelievably unrealistic, epic (or, more accuratly, 'epic'), empty and, sometimes, just stupid phrases (with each 2nd of them ending with god damn exclamation point).  The second is graphics. They are mediocre, at best. According to Steam this game was released in November 2015. Naruto Shipudden 3 was released in 2013, and it somehow looks better, with better faces, than in this game.  The gameplay is, probably, where Saint Seiya is better than you-know-what. In Naruto you just mash one button to attack, sometimes turn chakra mode on and maneuver around enemy. Here... well, you do the same, but here you have not one button to attack, but two! Not much of a difference for me, but point for trying. Except for it, everything is the same: projectiles, blocks, rushing to enemy, using a bit of 'mana', throws (which you made exactly the same way: by attacking, while blocking), special mode and special super attack. About super attacks. They suck. After Naruto, where special attacks were colourful, diverse and overall beautiful, here we have several attacks, made by hero, after standing for several seconds with some constellation as a background and, of course, shouting out the name of your attack, while doing it...  In the end, I can give this game 5/10. Very mediocre game with 'not bad' battle system, 'very bad' story mode and outdated graphics.  P.S. I've used Naruto, not because I'm some kind of fanboy (as I said earlier, I haven't experienced anything from this universe, aside from 3 games in Steam), but because it's an excellent example of how to make a game, based on anime that will be interesting, immersive and fun to play for everyone, not just those, for those, who know, what they're buying.

Single player review.  The good: I really enjoyed it. I've been looking for a good fighting game on Steam forever. I looked at Guilty Gear, SF series, DragonBall etc on youtube. They just don't give me satisfaction the Seiya game does when doing the power moves.  For me this was a dream come true to be able to live the anime characters and be the one fighting and using the powers! Phoenix is bada$$!   Sure it could use more story and better graphics but the animations are soo damn good and the game plays sooo smoothly. Works on Windows10.  The bad: Come on devs... there's barely any cloth suiting up animation.... I was so looking forward to that.  At the end of the day it's so much fun for me to relive the dream. Great stress release doing the BBA attacks!
It's an amazing game, maybe it could be kind of basic, but come on, it's a saint seiya game,   By the way, i'm looking for friends to play.  My username saidortiz91

I did not expect to see any Saint Seiya on PC maybe began to have hope when I noticed DBZ Xenoverse ... So fairly happy to have this game with no useless priceless DLC and ... with God warriors ! Some characters seem a bit unbalanced, the ones who are not that good in the anime are better in the game and (a bit) vice versa (was disappointed by Siegfried fast like a tank and not that strong !!!!).  The gameplay is solid and easy to learn (it is not SF that s for sure ...). I would recommend it mainly for Saint Seiya's fans otherwise you ll notice the poor stories tellings and so forth, hence better knowing all before playing !

If you've played the Naruto Ultimate Ninja Storm games, you have an idea of what to expect with this one. I'll say this though, I prefer this combat over Storm. It feels a bit more like a standard fighting game along with those anime fighter aspects to it. The character designs range from hysterical to bad*ss as f*ck. The story doesn't take too long and nets you most of the characters. The Gold Saint mode will also net you some great characters and all the while you can earn in game currency to purchase the remaining characaters and maps. Can't see much wrong with this if you enjoy anime fighters or the Saint Seiya franchise. Give it a shot.

PROS:   This game is all round wonderful, very well designed & it translates beautifully from Anime to Video game. Perhaps not to the full price value but certainly on any discount.   CONS:  No Italian transation, which is a pity since the series is incredibly popular with Italians.  Textures could be more higher resolution

Takes you back through most ofmthe story. Very complete in content. The graphics are OK, although shadows could be a lot better. Gameplay gets a lot more fun with time. Overall a fun game fir a long time fan of the series.
